methods.argstr: c: Card, extra_type: number, [attribute: number, race: number, level: number, atk: number, def: number]
methods.desc: Transforms a card (Card c) to a monster. The card type will become TYPE_MONSTER + extra_type. Uses the values if provided, otherwise uses the card's own values in Database. Be aware that the values added using this (except for Card type) will be reset when the card is flipped face-down.

Used in conjunction with Card.AddMonsterAttribute, completes a card's (Card c) transformation to a monster. It is best to call this after the card has arrived in Monster Zone (i.e. after Duel.SpecialSummonStep). Does nothing with cards without EFFECT_PRE_MONSTER (added automatically by Card.AddMonsterAttribute).
if cancel is true, cancels the to-grave rule and movement of a card (Card c). If false, enforce the rule that it must go from the field to Graveyard instead.
Give a min and a max tribute requirement of a card
Gets a card's (Card c) current battle target
Gets a card's (Card c) valid attack targets

methods.argstr: c: Card, type: number, value: number
methods.desc: Sets a card (Card c) hint displaying, type is CHINT_* and value is the appropriate value depending on the type
Reverse a card (Card c) in Deck (make it face-up)

methods.argstr: c: Card, s: number, o: number, unique_code: number[, unique_location: number=LOCATION_ONFIELD]
methods.desc: Sets a card's (Card c) "Can only control 1" clause, int s denotes checking of the would-be owner's field, int o denotes checking the opposing field. unique_location denotes the location the card is unique (setting location outside the field has no meaning)
Checks if a card's (Card c) going to a player's (int player) field would violate the "Can only control 1" clause
Reset a card c affected by the effect of cards whose card number is code1, code2 ...

Assume a property for a card (Card c), the card will be considered as having an assumed specific property (int assume_type) as the inputted value (int assume_value) (only as long as the function is still processing)

Make a card (Card c) can only be Special Summoned when the turn has not Special Summoned another card with the same code (int code) as its Card.SetSpecialSummonOnce. Basically, makes the "You can only Special Summon "Some Monster" once per turn" condition
Changes (Card c)'s original card name if (int code) is inputted, else returns the current original card name.
Changes (Card c)'s alias if (int code) is inputted, else returns the current card's alias.
Changes (Card c)'s original archetype(s)/setcode(s) if (int setcode) is inputted, else returns the current card's original archetype(s)/setcode(s).
Changes (Card c)'s original type(s) if (int type) is inputted, else returns the current card's original type(s).
Changes (Card c)'s original level if (int level) is inputted, else returns the current card's original level
Changes (Card c)'s original attribute(s) if (int att) is inputed, else returns the current card's original attribute(s).
Changes (Card c)'s original monster type(s)/race(s) if (int race) is inputed, else returns the current card's original monster type(s)/race(s).
Changes (Card c)'s original ATK if (int val) is inputted, else returns the current card's original ATK.
Changes (Card c)'s original DEF if (int val) is inputted, else returns the current card's original DEF.
Changes (Card c)'s original left scale if (int scale) is inputted, else returns the current card's original left scale.
Changes (Card c)'s original right scale if (int scale) is inputted, else returns the current card's original right scale.
Changes (Card c)'s original Link Markers if (int linkmarker) is inputted, else returns the current card's original Link Markers.

methods.argstr: c: Card, code: number[, alias: number|nil, setcode: number|nil, type: number|nil, level: number|nil, attribute: number|nil, race: number|nil, atk: number|nil, def: number|nil, lscale: number|nil, rscale: number|nil, replace_effect: boolean|nil=false]
methods.desc: Changes (Card c) into a card with (int code) as its original card number from the database. If any of the parameters are included, that stat is also changed. If (bool replace_effect) is set to true, its effect also changes to the effects of (int code).
Checks if a card is Extra Linked, uses aux.ExtraLinked which obtains 2 Extra Monster Zone monsters of each player and checks if (Card c) is included in the chain of co-linked cards.

methods.argstr: c: Card, seq: number, tp: number, loc: number
methods.desc: Checks (Card c) its column using the data of another card which allows checking even if the other card has already left the field using its Sequence (int seq), controller (int tp) and location (int loc)
Interacts with the functions for "Salamangreat" Reincarnation procedure. Returns if card c has CARD_SALAMANGREAT_SANCTUARY as FlagEffect
Returns if (Card c) is a Monster and does not have TYPE_EFFECT

Returns if a Card (Card c) has a level, which means it must match these criteria: not have TYPE_LINK, not have STAUS_NO_LEVEL, not be an Xyz, unless it is an Xyz that has EFFECT_RANK_LEVEL or EFFECT_RANK_LEVEL_S. A native check for TYPE_MONSTER was not included
Returns if a Card (Card c) is located at any of the sequences passed as arguments
Return if (Card c) is in a Main Monster Zone. If (int tp) is provided, also returns if (Card c) is of that controller.
Return if (Card c) is in an Extra Monster Zone. If (int tp) is provided, also returns if (Card c) is of that controller.
Returns if (Card c) is a Ritual Monster.
Returns if (Card c) is a Ritual Spell.
Checks if (Card c) has original card name of (int cd)
Checks if (Card c) has original code rule of (int cd)
Checks if (Card c) is of original card type (int val)
Checks if (Card c) is of original attribute (int val)
Checks if (Card c) is of original monster type (int val)
Checks if (Card c) is summoned by player (int tp)
Checks if (Card c) is previous controlled by player (int tp)
Checks if (Card c) is summoned from location (int loc)
Returns if Card C is a Link Monster. This function was added due to the introduction of Link Spells that makes checking only for IsType==TYPE_LINK not accurate depending on the effect used.
Returns if Card C is a Link Spell.
Create a new effect object with a card (Card c) as it's owner
Create a new effect object without owner
Clone an effect object (Effect e), duplicating all except register status and assigned labels
Reset an effect (Effect e), effectively deleting it
Gets a unique ID representing a certain instance of an effect.
Sets an effect's (Effect e) description string id with (int desc) taken from cdb and strings.conf (description in cdb is [cardnumber *16+index], aux.Stringid is a shortcut).
Sets an effect's (Effect e) category. Refer to constant.lua for valid categories.
Sets an effect's (Effect e) type. Refer to constant.lua and card scripts that has been already there for valid types (or ask someone).
Sets an effect's (Effect e) code. Refer to constant.lua and card scripts that has been already there for valid codes (or ask someone).

methods.argstr: e: Effect, prop1: number[, prop2: number]
methods.desc: Sets an effect's (Effect e) property. Refer to constant.lua and card scripts that has been already there for valid properties (or ask someone).
Sets an effect's (Effect e) effective range (int range) i.e. LOCATION_MZONE. The location is the effect handler's location.

methods.argstr: e: Effect, playerid: number, s_range: number, o_range: number
methods.desc: Sets an effect's (Effect e) target range in perspective of the supplied player (int playerid), s_range denotes the supplied player's range and o_range denotes the opponent's.

methods.argstr: e: Effect, count: number[, code: number=0]
methods.desc: Sets an effect's (Effect e) use limit per turn to (int count), if code is supplied, then it would count toward all effects with the same count limit code (i.e. Hard OPT)

methods.argstr: e: Effect, reset_flag: number[, reset_count: number=1]
methods.desc: Sets the timing that the effect (Effect e) would be erased (with reset_flag)
Sets an effect's (Effect e) internal label to (int label)
Sets an effect's (Effect e) internal label object to labelobject

methods.argstr: e: Effect, s_time: number[, o_time: number=s_time]
methods.desc: Sets an activated (Effect e)'s client usage hint timing
Sets (Effect e)'s condition function
Sets (Effect e)'s cost function
Sets (Effect e)'s target function

methods.argstr: e: Effect, s_range: number, o_range: number
methods.desc: Sets (Effect e)'s target range, s_range denotes the effect's handler player's range and o_range denotes the opponent's.
Sets (Effect e)'s value, or value function
Sets (Effect e)'s operation function
Sets (Effect e)'s owner player (the [int player] is actually not optional)
Gets (Effect e)'s assigned description string id
Gets (Effect e)'s code
Get (Effect e)'s remaining, and maximum count limit, and any code parameter (e.g. detect "The effect of "card name" can only be used once per turn.)
Gets (Effect e)'s reset flag and reset count.
Gets an effect's (Effect e) type
Gets an effect's (Effect e) property
Gets an effect's (Effect e) internal label
Gets an effect's (Effect e) internal label object
Gets an effect's (Effect e) category
Gets an effect's (Effect e) card owner, if the owner is not a card (GlobalEffect) then returns nil
Gets an effect's (Effect e) card handler, if the effect is not attached to a card (i.e. registered to player) it returns nil
Gets an effect's (Effect e) condition function, returns nil if no function was set
Gets an effect's (Effect e) target function, returns nil if no function was set
Gets an effect's (Effect e) cost function, returns nil if no function was set
Gets an effect's (Effect e) value or value function, returns nil if no function was set
Gets an effect's (Effect e) operation function, returns nil if no function was set

Gets an effect's (Effect e) card type of activation effect. Activation type is often the effect handler's card type, or the owner's if not attached to a card. Exception for Pendulum scale activation (would return TYPE_SPELL+TYPE_PENDULUM).

Compares (with OR) an effect's (Effect e) card type of activation effect with supplied type (int type). Activation type is often the handler's card type, or the owner's if not attached to a card. Exception for Pendulum scale activation (would return TYPE_SPELL+TYPE_PENDULUM).
Gets an effect's (Effect e) owner player
Gets an effect's (Effect e) handler player

methods.argstr: e: Effect, prop1: number[, prop2: number]
methods.desc: Returns true if the effect (Effect e) has any property listed in (int prop1) or (int prop2), otherwise returns false
Returns true if the effect (Effect e) has any category listed in (int cate), otherwise returns false
Returns true if the effect (Effect e) has any type listed in (int type), otherwise returns false
Checks if an effect (Effect e) can be activated by a player (int player)
Checks if an effect (Effect e) is an activated effect (not continuous and is a triggering effect)
Get the effect's (Effect e) applicable range (gets it's s_range)
Get (Effect e)'s sequence when it was activated.
Create a new Group object
Make a group (Group g) not be destroyed upon exiting the function
Destroy a group (Group g)
Create a copy of a group (Group g) with the same members
Create a new Group object and populate it with cards (Card c, ...)
Empty a group (Group g)
Add a card (Card c) to a group (Group g)
Remove a card (Card c) from a group (Group g)
Gets the first member of Group g (also resets the internal enumerator)
Gets then next member of Group g (moves the internal enumerator by a step)
return a new group made of cards that are only in the position specified (int pos)
Gets the amount of objects in a group (Group g)
Executes a function for each card in a group (Group g), function f should accept one parameter (e.g. f(c, ...), with c as each member of the group and ... can be any number of parameters)

methods.argstr: g: Group, f: function, ex: Group|Card|nil, ...
methods.desc: Create a new group with members from another group (Group g) filtered according to a function (function f). Excludes a card/group (Group/Card ex) if not nil. Function f accepts at least one parameter (f(c,...), with c as each member of the group), and the card will be included if f(c,...) returns true.

methods.argstr: g: Group, f: function, ex: Group|Card|nil, ...
methods.desc: Counts the amount of members of a group (Group g) which meets the function (function f). Excludes a card (Card ex) if not nil. Function f accepts at least one parameter (f(c,...), with c as each member of the group), and the card will be included if f(c,...) returns true.

methods.argstr: g: Group, player: number, f: function, min: number, max: number[, cancelable: boolean=false], ex: Group|Card|nil, ...
methods.desc: Make a player (int player) select members of a group (Group g) which meets the function (function f), with a minimum and a maximum, then outputs the result as a new Group. Excludes a card (Card ex) if not nil. Function f accepts at least one parameter (f(c,...), with c as each member of the group), and the card will be included if f(c,...) returns true. If cancelable is true and the selection is canceled nil will be returned.

methods.argstr: g: Group, player: number, min: number, max: number[, cancelable: boolean=false] ex: Group|Card|nil
methods.desc: Make a player (int player) select members of a group (Group g), with a minimum and a maximum, then outputs the result as a new Group. Excludes a card (Card ex) if not nil. If cancelable is true and the selection is canceled nil will be returned.

methods.argstr: g1: Group, g2: Group, player: number[, finishable: boolean, cancelable: boolean, min: number, max: number]
methods.desc: Selects cards in a loop that allows unselection/cancellation. (Group g1) is the group of not selected cards, (Group g2) is the group of already selected cards, (int player) is the player who selects the card, (bool finishable) indicates that the current selection has met the requirements and thus can be finished with the right click, (bool cancelable) indicates that the selection can be canceled with the right click (in the procedures this is set when the selected group is empty and no chain is going on), (int max) and (int min) does nothing to the function, they are only the max and min values shown in the hint. Every card in both the groups can be selected. The function returns a single card

methods.argstr: g: Group, player: number, count: number
methods.desc: Make a player (int player) randomly select (int amount) members of a group (Group g).

methods.argstr: g: Group, f: function, count: number, ex: Group|Card|nil, ...
methods.desc: Checks if at least a number (int count) of members of a group (Group g) meet the function (function f). Excludes a card (Card ex) if not nil. Function f accepts at least one parameter (f(c,...), with c as each member of the group), and the card will be included if f(c,...) returns true.

methods.argstr: g: Group, f: function, sum: number, min: number, max: number, ...
methods.desc: Checks if there is a combination of cards, with a minimum and maximum, that has the sum of f(c,...) result equal to (int sum) in a group (Group g). Function f accepts at least one parameter (f(c,...). with c as each member of the group), and the return value should be integer.

methods.argstr: g: Group, player: number, f: function, sum: number, min: number, max: number, ...
methods.desc: Makes a player (int player) select members of a group (Group g) which results in a combination of cards, with a minimum and maximum, that has the sum of f(c,...) result equal to (int sum). Function f accepts at least one parameter (f(c,...), with c as each member of the group), and the return value should be integer.

methods.argstr: g: Group, f: function, sum: number, ...
methods.desc: Checks if there is a combination of cards, with a minimum and maximum, that has the sum of f(c,...) result greater than or equal to (int sum) in a group (Group g). Function f accepts at least one parameter (f(c,...), with c as each member of the group), and the return value should be integer.

methods.argstr: g: Group, player: number, f: function, sum: number, ...
methods.desc: Makes a player (int player) select members of a group (Group g) which results in a combination of cards, with a minimum and maximum, that has the sum of f(c,...) result greater than or equal to (int sum). Function f accepts at least one parameter (f(c,...), with c as each member of the group), and the return value should be integer.

Create a new group with members from another group (Group g) which has the minimum result from f(c,...). Function f accepts at least one parameter (f(c,...), with c as each member of the group), and the return value should be integer, if the group g have no element, that function will return nil.

Create a new group with members from another group (Group g) which has the maximum result from f(c,...). Function f accepts at least one parameter (f(c,...), with c as each member of the group), and the return value should be integer, if the group g have no element, that function will return nil.

Gets the sum of f(c,...) result from all members of a group (Group g). Function f accepts at least one parameter (f(c,...), with c as each member of the group), and the return value should be integer.

Gets the count of different f(c,...) results from all members of a group (Group g). Function f accepts at least one parameter (f(c,...), with c as each member of the group), and the return value should be integer.

methods.argstr: g: Group, f: function, ex: Group|Card|nil, ...
methods.desc: Removes members of a group (Group g) that meets the function (function f). Excludes a card (Card ex) from removal if not nil. Function f accepts at least one parameter (f(c,...), with c as each member of the group), and the card will be included if f(c,...) returns true.
Inserts members of the second group (Group g2) to the first group (Group g1). (This will alter g1)
Removes members of the second group (Group g2) from the first group (Group g1). (This will alter g1)
Checks if the first group (Group g1) has the same members with the second group (Group g2)
Checks if a group (Group g) contains a specified card (Card c)
Gets the first card found in a group (Group g) which f(c,...) returns true. Function f accepts at least one parameter (f(c,...), with c as each member of the group), and must return a boolean.
split group g into 2 groups, first is card that match the function f and the second one are the other cards.
Checks if (Group g1) contains all cards in (Group g2)
Returns if the members of (Group  g) share a same property, provided in (Function f)
Returns the zones that belong to player "tp" and are pointed to by at least "count" Link Monsters.
Enables the specified global flags (int global_flag) for the rest of the Duel (GLOBALFLAG_x).
Gets a specified player's (int player) current Life Point value
Sets a specified player's (int player) current Life Point value to a value (int lp)
Gets the turn's player
Gets the turn count
Gets the draw count for normal draw for a player (int player)
Register an effect (Effect e) to a player (int player)

methods.argstr: player: number, code: number, reset_flag: number, property: number, reset_count: number
methods.desc: Registers a flag effect to a player (int player) with (int code) as the effect code
Gets the flag effect with (int code) as the effect code that is registered to a player (int player), returns 0 if no effect, a positive integer otherwise
Resets a flag with (int code) as the effect code from a player (int player)

methods.argstr: targets: Card|Group, reason: number[ ,dest: number = LOCATION_GRAVE]
methods.desc: Destroys a card or group (Card|Group targets) with (int reason) as reason, if (int dest) is supplied, the destination of the destroyed cards will be it's value. Returns the number of cards successfully destroyed.

methods.argstr: targets: Card|Group, pos: number, reason: number[,player: number]
methods.desc: Banishes a card or group (Card|Group targets) in position as supplied by (int pos) (nil means default banish position), with (int reason) as reason, if (int player) is supplied, the destination would be that player's zone. Returns the number of cards successfully banished.

methods.argstr: targets: Card|Group, reason: number[, player: number]
methods.desc: Sends a card or group (Card|Group targets) to the Graveyard with (int reason) as reason, if (int player) is supplied, the destination would be that player's Graveyard. Returns the number of cards successfully sent.

methods.argstr: targets: Card|Group, player: number|nil, reason: number
methods.desc: Sends a card or group (Card|Group targets) to the Hand with (int reason) as reason, if (int player) is supplied, the destination would be that player's Hand. Returns the number of cards successfully sent.

methods.argstr: targets: Card|Group, player: number|nil, seq: number, reason: number
methods.desc: Sends a card or group (Card|Group targets) to the Deck with (int reason) as reason, if (int player) is supplied, the destination would be that player's Deck. A seq value of 0 means it's put on the top, 1 means it's put on the bottom, other values means it's put on the top, and the Deck will be shuffled after the function resolution except if Duel.DisableShuffleCheck() is set to true beforehand. Returns the number of cards successfully sent.

methods.argstr: targets: Card|Group, player: number|nil, reason: number
methods.desc: Sends a card or group (Card|Group targets) to the Extra Deck face-up with (int reason) as reason, if (int player) is supplied, the destination would be that player's Extra Deck (for Pendulum monsters only). Returns the number of cards successfully sent.

methods.argstr: Card|Group, location: number, reason: number,[pos: number=POS_FACEUP, player: number=PLAYER_NONE, sequence: number=0]
methods.desc: Sends a card or group (Card|Group targets) to the location (int location) with (int reason) as reason in (ins pos) position (only applies in Extra Deck and Banish). If (int player) is supplied, the destination would be that player's location. A seq value of 0 means it's put on the top, 1 means it's put on the bottom, other values means it's put on the top, and the if it is Deck, it will be shuffled after the function resolution except if Duel.DisableShuffleCheck() is set to true beforehand. Returns the number of cards successfully sent.
Gets the last group of operated cards (from last call of some functions, ex. calling this after Duel.Draw would return a group of the drawn cards)

methods.argstr: player: number, c: Card, ignore_count: boolean, e: Effect|nil[, min=0]
methods.desc: Makes a player (int player) Normal Summons a card (Card c) using the Normal Summon procedure that the card has. If (ignore_count) is set to true, the Summon would not count towards the standard limit of Normal Summon/Set. If an effect (Effect e) is provided, the Normal Summon is counted as a Summon by that effect. If (min) is greater than 0, the Summon proc must need that amount or more tributes.
A player (int player) Special Summons a card (Card c) using Special Summon proc that the card has

methods.argstr: player: number, c: Card[, must_use: Group|Card|nil, mg: Group|Card|nil, minc: number=0, maxc: number=0]
methods.desc: A player (int player) Synchro Summons a card (Card c) using "must_use" as part of its materials, choosing among "mg", with "min" and "max" materials to be used for the Summon

methods.argstr: player: number, c: Card[, must_use: Group|Card|nil, mg: Group|Card|nil, minc: number=0, maxc: number=0]
methods.desc: A player (int player) Xyz Summons a card (Card c) using "must_use" as part of its materials, choosing among "mg", with "min" and "max" materials to be used for the Summon

methods.argstr: player: number, c: Card[, must_use: Group|Card|nil, mg: Group|Card|nil, minc: number=0, maxc: number=0]
methods.desc: A player (int player) Link Summons a card (Card c) using "must_use" as part of its materials, choosing among "mg", with "min" and "max" materials to be used for the Summon.
Loads into the current enviroment (duel/puzzle) (file_name)'s script.

methods.argstr: player: number, c: Card, ignore_count: boolean, e: Effect|nil[, min=0]
methods.desc: A player Sets a card (Card c) using Normal Summon proc that the card has. if ignore_count is true, the Set would not count towards the standard limit of Normal Summon/Set. If an effect (Effect e) is provided, the Normal Set is counted as a Set by that effect. if min>0 then the Set proc must need that amount or more tributes.

methods.argstr: player: number, targets: Card|Group[, target_player: number = player, show: boolean]
methods.desc: A player Sets a card/cards (Card|Group target) to the Spell/Trap Card Zone. If target_player is provided, then the player will Set the card to that target player's field, if bool show is set to false, the card set is not revealed - for confirmation - to the opponent.

methods.argstr: player: number, code: number[, setcode: number, attack: number, defense: number, level: number, race: number, attribute: number]
methods.desc: Create a token for a player (int player) with card code (int code)

methods.argstr: targets: Card|Group, sumtype: number, sumplayer: number, target_player: number, nocheck: boolean, nolimit: boolean, pos: number
methods.desc: A player (int sumplayer) Special Summons a card/group of cards (Card|Group targets) with summon type described with SUMMON_TYPE_x (int sumtype) to a player's (int target_player) field. Returns the number of cards successfully summoned.

methods.argstr: c: Card, sumtype: number, sumplayer: number, target_player: number, nocheck: boolean, nolimit: boolean, pos: number
methods.desc: A player (int sumplayer) Special Summons a card (Card c) with summon type described with SUMMON_TYPE_x (int sumtype) to a player's (int target_player) field.
Completes Special Summons conducted with Duel.SpecialSummonStep

methods.argstr: player: number, countertype: number, count: number, c: Card
methods.desc: Checks whether a player (int player) can add a number (int count) of counters (int countertype) to a card (Card c)
Check if the current duel is of the current flag (ex: using DUEL_OBSOLETE_RULING will check if it obsolete rulings)

methods.argstr: player: number, s: number, o: number, countertype: number, count: number, reason: number
methods.desc: Makes a player (int player) remove counter(s) (int countertype) (int count) from the field with a reason (int reason). The variables int s and int o are the player's and the opponent's field, respectively, 0 to exclude and 1 (or higher) to include.

methods.argstr: player: number, s: number, o: number, countertype: number, count: number, reason: number
methods.desc: Checks if a player (int player) can remove counter(s) (int countertype) (int count) from the field with a reason (int reason). The variables int s and int o are the player's and the opponent's field, respectively, 0 to exclude and 1 (or higher) to include.

methods.argstr: player: number, s: number, o: number, countertype: number
methods.desc: Gets the number of counter (int countertype) on the field, from a player's (int player) perspective. The variables int s and int o are the player's and the opponent's field, respectively, 0 to exclude and 1 (or higher) to include.

methods.argstr: targets: Card|Group, au: number[, ad: number=au, du: number=au, dd: number=au, noflip: boolean=false]
methods.desc: Changes the battle position of (Card|Group targets). (int au), (int ad), int (du) and (int dd) are the positions cards in face-up attack, face-down attack, face-up defense, and face-down defense positions will be changed to, respectively. If (bool noflip) is true, FLIP effects will not be activated by this change. Returns the number of cards successfully affected.
Tribute a card(s) (Card|Group targets) with listed reason (int reason). Returns the number of cards successfully Tributed.

methods.argstr: c: Card, move_player: number, target_player: number, dest: number, pos: number, enabled: boolean, zone: number = 0xff
methods.desc: A player (int move_player) moves a card (Card c) to the target player's field. The destination must be either LOCATION_MZONE or LOCATION_SZONE (maybe LOCATION_ONFIELD too). It will be sent with the given position (int pos). Its effects will either be enabled or disabled according to the last parameter (bool enabled), if zone is specified, it can only place the card in these zones.
Return a card (Card c) to the field (only valid for cards that leaves the field with REASON_TEMPORARY, pos denotes the return position (if not specified, uses the card's previous position on field)
Move a card (Card c) to another sequence within its location (int seq)

Sets a function for limiting effects that could chain from this point in the chain, removed when an effect is chained to the current chain. Function f accepts at most 3 parameters [f(e,tp,p)] in which e is the effect that would be chained, tp is the same tp from the effect function where this function is called , and p is the player who would activate the would-be chaining effect.

Sets a function for limiting effects that could chain from this point for the chain until the end of the chain. Function f accepts at most 3 parameters [f(e,tp,p)] in which e is the effect that would be chained, tp is the same tp from the effect function where this function is called , and p is the player who would activate the would-be chaining effect.

methods.argstr: c: Card, mustbefaceup: boolean, includemzone: boolean
methods.desc: Spirit Elimination check to (Card c). It checks if controller is affected by Spirit Elimination. If so, it will only filter in the Monster Zone, otherwise in Graveyard. (bool mustbefaceup) means the filter is not generic (e.g. Banish 1 Dragon-Type monster) opposed to banish 1 monster. (bool includemzone) when set to true will check LOCATION_MZONE by default as opposed to filtering LOCATION_MZONE and LOCATION_GRAVE depending on affected by Spirit Elimination.

methods.argstr: c: Card, con: function|nil, equipval: function|nil, equipop: function, linkedeff: Effect, prop: number|nil, resetflag: number|nil, resetcount: number|nil
methods.desc: Registers effects that need to be checked for the effect of "Millennium-Eyes Illusionist". (function con) is any conditions that need to be fulfilled in order to apply its "equipping" effect. (function equipval) is the filter of valid monsters you can equip to it. (function equipop) is the equipping by its effect. (Effect linkedeff) is the effect that equips. (int prop) is the list of additional properties for SetProperty to register effects. (int resetflag) and (int resetcount) is used if the effect would reset such as, until only the End Phase.

methods.argstr: c: Card, e: Effect, tp: number, tc: Card, code: number|nil, mustbefaceup: boolean
methods.desc: Equips (Card tc) to (Card c). Adding a (int code) will register that code as flag effect to the equipped card  (bool mustbefaceup) defines if the card to be equipped is required to be face-up.

methods.argstr: tp: number, min: number, max: number
methods.desc: (int tp) declares a number by digit with a minimum of (int min) and maximum of (int max)
Resets all effects with code (int eff) in a group of cards defined (Group g).
Function is used mostly for Anime Cards calling 419/420 to enable more functions. Also used in Anime Numbers with alias to prevent errors made by alias.

methods.argstr: g: Group, e: Effect, tp: number, minc: number = 1, maxc: number = 99, rescon: function|nil, chk: number, seltp: number, hintmsg: number, cancelcon: function|nil, breakcon: function|nil
methods.desc: Recursion checking and selection. (Group g) is the group to check and choose from, with a minimum (int minc) that defaults to 1 if set to nil and maximum (int maxc) that defaults to 99 if set to nil. (function rescon) is the condition to check which is needed fulfill. (int chk) is set to 0 to check and 1 to select. (int seltp) is the selecting player. (int hintmsg) is the HINTMSG that will be displayed on selection. (function cancelcon) is the condition when fulfilled allows you to end selection. (function breakcon) when fulfilled ends the selection automatically.
Filter to check monsters if it's on a Main Monster Zone

methods.argstr: sumcount: number)(sg: Group, e: Effect, tp: number, mg: Group
methods.desc: Used in rescon by default. 2nd parenthesis is not required as rescon/cancelcon in aux.SelectUnselectGroup. (Group sg) is the selected group when using aux.SelectUnselectGroup.

methods.argstr: e: Effect, tp: number, eg: Group|nil, ep: number, ev: number, re: Effect, r: number, rp: number, chk: number
methods.desc: cost that is used in cards that stay on the field if they finish resolving. (e.g. Kunai with Chain, Different Dimension Burial)

methods.argstr: func: function|nil, sumtype: number, sump: number, targetp: number, nocheck: boolean, nolimit: boolean, pos: number, mmz: number, emz: number)(e: Effect, tp: number, eg: Group, ep: number,ev: number, re: Effect, r: number, rp: number, sg: Group
methods.desc: Loops Special Summoning (Group sg) to ensure they go in a valid zone (Extra Moster Zone and Main Monster Zones) where (function func) is a function called after each card in the Group is summoned with the parameters (Effect e, int tp, Group eg, int ep,int ev, Effect re, int r, int rp, Card sc) where (Card sc) is the card that's Summoned. (int sumtype) is the Summon Type. (int sump) is the Summoning player. (int targetp) is the target player. (bool nocheck) checks for "ignoring the Summoning conditions". And (bool nolimit) checks for "ignoring proper Summon". (int pos) is the position to be Summoned. (int mmz) is the zones where you can Special Summon monsters in (Group sg) to the Main Monster Zone, which defaults to all Main Monster Zones if there is no input or nil is inputed. (int emz) on the other is similar to (int mmz) excepts it checks for cards from the Extra Deck which Special Summons to the Extra Monster Zone.

methods.argstr: c: Card, f: function, oldrule: boolean
methods.desc: Adds the Union Procedure to (Card c) where (function f) is the cards you can equip the Union monster to, and (bool oldrule) is a check to apply old rulings of the Union monster.
Used as a default condition to check if the handler of the effect is a Union monster equipped to another monster.
A check if you can equip a Union monster (Card uc) to (Card tc).

methods.argstr: c: Card, p: number|nil, f: function|nil, eqlimit: function|nil, cost: function|nil, tg: function|nil, op: function|nil, con: function|nil
methods.desc: Adds the Equip Card Activation where (int p) is the player, setting 0 will limit to monsters you control, setting to 1 will be your opponent and PLAYER_ALL/nil will be for either player. (function f) is the filters on which monsters you can equip it to. (function eqlimit) if provided will that limitation on which monsters you can only equip it (e.g. Those that can only be equipped by this activation, e.g. Train Connection). (function cost) would be the cost to activate it. (function tg) are effects that applied to it after targeting the monster to equip, and also checking requirements. (function op) is any operation that is applied after the Equip Proc equips. (function con) returns a bool which are conditions that need to be fulfilled for the Equip Card to be activated.

methods.argstr: e: Effect, tp: number, eg: Group, ep: number, ev: number, re: Effect, r: number, rp: number
methods.desc: Used to equip the Equip Card to the targeted monster. This would be used if you cannot use the Equip Procedure for your Equip Card activation.

methods.argstr: c: Card, p: number|nil, f: function|nil, category: number|nil, property: number|nil, hint1: number|nil, hint2: number|nil, con: function|nil, cost: function|nil, tg: function|nil, op: function|nil, anypos: boolean|nil
methods.desc: Adds the Persistent Trap Procedure where is the player, setting 0 will limit to monsters you control, setting to 1 will be your opponent and PLAYER_ALL/nil will be for either player. (function f) is the filters on which monsters you can target. (bool anypos) is a check if the target needs to be face-up. Setting this to true will allow it to be targeted even if it isn't face-up.
Default filter for checking if it's targeted by the Persistent Trap.
Checks for cards with different names (to be used with aux.SelectUnselectGroup)

Auxiliary function for "Salamangreat" Reincarnation procedure. Registers CARD_SALAMANGREAT_SANCTUARY as flag  to (card c) if it is either a Link, Fusion or Ritual and has among its materials a card with the same ID as (card c).
Auxiliary filter for "Salamangreat" Reincarnation procedure to handle the rituals.
Auxiliary function for "Salamangreat" Reincarnation procedure. Returns if (card c) is either a Fusion, Ritual or a Link.
Auxiliary function for "Salamangreat" Reincarnation procedure. Enables reincarnation links.
Used as filter for the uniqueness on field with the "Malefic" monsters
Procedure for "Malefic" monsters' Special Summon (also includes handling of "Malefic Paradox Gear"'s effect)
Filter used with AddMaleficSummonProcedure. Returns if card (Card c)'s ID is (cd) and if c can be banished as cost
Used with the Summoning Procedure of "Malefic" monsters. Checks for the effect of "Malefic Paradox Gear"
Auxiliary function for the summoning procedure of "Malefic" monsters. Checks if the player has the zone to summon and the appropriate monster (cd) to banish.
Auxiliary function to handle the summoning procedure of "Malefic" monsters. Performs the actual summon of the monster by removing the appropriate monster.

Used as filter for effects that check "if [filter] monster is Special Summoned to a zone this card points to". Also includes non-trivial handling of self-destructing effects of "Burning Abyss" monsters.

Used as condition for effects that check "if a [filter] monster is Special Summoned to a zone this card points to". Includes non-trivial handling of self-destructing Burning Abyss monsters. tp is passed to check control.
Auxiliary function for the discard cost of "Witchcrafter" monsters. Returns if (Card c) can be either sent to the GY as a cost or has EFFECT_WITCHCRAFT_REPLACE.

Auxiliary function for the discard cost of "Witchcrafter" monsters. Returns if there is a card with EFFECT_WITCHCRAFTER_REPLACE, that can be used as the whole cost, of if there is a (minc) number of cards to use as cost,  minc is the ammount the effect requires to discard.

Auxiliary function for the discard cost of "Witchcrafter" monsters. Performs the actual discard part, considering a minimum (minc) and maximum (maxc) amount of cards to discard. It also handles cards with EFFECT_WITCHCRAFTER_REPLACE, setting the reason for REASON_COST for those, or REASON_COST+REASON_DISCARD if a card is sent from hand instead.

methods.argstr: c: card, required: number, position: number, filter: funtion, value: number, description: number
methods.desc: Adds Lava Golem-like procedure (monster that tribute to Special Summon on opponent's field), int required is the amount of monster to tribute, position is which position is it summoned and filter specify the monster it must tribute, value sets the type of Special summon and description adds a description for it. Calls the following auxiliary functions: LavaCondition, LavaCheck, LavaTarget and LavOperation.
Adds Kaiju's stardand procedure to the monster (which also includes the uniqueness on field condition). Calls the following auxilary function: KaijuCondition

methods.argstr: c: card, zone: number, tp: number
methods.desc: Returns if (card c) is in the (int zone), (int tp) is the reference player.

methods.argstr: c: card, player: number, [check: function, oper: function, str],...
methods.desc: Makes (int player) either add (card c) to hand or perform a secondary action. If the optional parameters are not provided, the default secondary action is to send (card c) to the GY. If  the provided (function check) is true, the secondary action, with string called from (str), will be the one defined in (function oper).
Sends (card c) to the grave. Function added to be used with aux.ToHandOrElse

methods.argstr: c: Card, property_code: number, reg: number.player, s: number, o: number, str, reset_code: number
methods.desc: Auxiliary function to simplify registering EFFECT_FLAG_CLIENT_HINT to players. (Card c) is card that creates the hint message,  (int property_code) are additional properties like EFFECT_FLAG_OATH (PLAYER_TARGET and CLIENT_HINT are the flags registered by default). (int reg. player) is the player that is registering the hint, to himself (int s) and/or the opponent (int o), with a description called from a string defined in (str). Additional resets, other than the default RESET_PHASE+PHASE_END, can be passed in (int reset_code).

Activates a field spell Card "c". Already handles interactions with Field Spells that are already face up, rules for only 1 Field Spell at time, checks for costs and activated effects of the field spell and als the interaction with Ancient Pixie Dragon.
Enables a global check to be used with function "func"
Default SetValue for "Evil HERO" monsters's effect EFFECT_SPSUMMON_CONDITION. Must be used due to the existance of "Supreme King Castle"

methods.argstr: c: Card, sub: boolean, insf: boolean, ...: number|function
methods.desc: Adds a Fusion Procedure where (bool sub) is a check if Fusion Substitutes are allowed. (bool insf) is a check if using no materials are allowed (e.g. Instant Fusion). (int|function ...) is a list of any number of codes/conditions as Fusion Materials.
A variable used temporarily to limit the usable materials' number
A variable used temporarily to add further checks (e.g. only up to 2 materials from the Extra Deck: Odd-Eyes Fusion)

methods.argstr: c: Card, sub: boolean, insf: boolean, fun1: function, minc: number, maxc: number, ...: number|function
methods.desc: Adds a Fusion Procedure where (bool sub) is a check if Fusion Substitutes are allowed. (bool insf) is a check if using no materials are allowed (e.g. Instant Fusion). (function fun1) is a condition for a Fusion Material with a minimum (int minc) and maximum (int maxc) and (int|function ...) is a list of any number of codes/conditions as Fusion Materials.

methods.argstr: c: Card, group: function, op: function, sumcon: function, condition: function|nil, sumtype: number = 0, desc: number|nil
methods.desc: Adds a Contact Fusion Procedure to a Fusion monster which is a Summoning Procedure without having to use "Polymerization". (function group) is a function with (int tp) parameter which returns a Group of usable materials. (function op) is the operation that will be applied to the selected materials. (function sumcon) adds a limitation on a Fusion monster which applies to EFFECT_SPSUMMON_CONDITION. (function condition) is an additional condition to check. (int sumtype) is the Summon Type of the Contact Fusion, which defaults to 0. (int desc) is the description of the Summoning Procedure when selecting it.

methods.argstr: c: Card, sub: boolean, insf: boolean, number|function, ...: number
methods.desc: Adds a Fusion Procedure where (bool sub) is a check if Fusion Substitutes are allowed. (bool insf) is a check if using no materials are allowed (e.g. Instant Fusion). (int|function ...) is a list of any number of codes/conditions as Fusion Materials, by pairs wherein the first value is int/function which is the code or condition, and the second value is an int which corresponds to the number of fixed materials.

methods.argstr: c: Card, insf: boolean, f: function, att: number
methods.desc: Adds a Fusion Procedure where (bool insf) is a check if using no materials are allowed (e.g. Instant Fusion) and accepts 1 condition (function f) and 1 Attribute (int att).

methods.argstr: c: card, fusfilter: function, matfilter: function, extrafil: function ,extraop, gc, stage2: function, exactcount: number, value: number, location: number, chkf, desc: string
methods.desc: The function that generates a Fusion Summon effect. By default it's usable for Spells/Traps, usage in monsters requires changing type and code afterwards. Card c is card that uses the effect, fusfilter is the filter for the monster to be Fusion Summoned, matfilter is a function with the restrictions on the default materials returned by GetFusionMaterial,  extrafil is a function that returns a group of extra cards that can be used as fusion materials, and as second optional parameter an additional filter function, extraop is function called right before sending the monsters to the graveyard as material, gc is mandatory card or function returning a group to be used (for effects like Soprano), stage2 is a function called after the monster has been summoned (Shaddol Ruq, Instant Fusion, Flash Fusion, etc.), exactcount is the exact number of materials that must be used if the effect requires is (e.g. Ostinato), int location is the location where to summon fusion monsters from (default LOCATION_EXTRA), chkf are FUSPROC flags for the fusion summon, desc calls a string for the summon effect description.
Adds a Ritual Summoning activation requring Tributes that meet (function filter), and with levels equal to or greater than the Ritual Monster's level
Adds a Ritual Summoning activation requring Tributes for a Ritual monster with any of the card names of code (int ...), and with levels equal to or greater than the Ritual Monster's level

methods.argstr: c: Card, filter: function, lv: number[, desc: number]
methods.desc: Adds a Ritual Summoning activation, requring Tributes that meet (function filter), and with levels exactly equal to the Ritual Monster's level or if (int lv) is provided, with level equal to that value. (int desc) is the description when activating the Ritual Spell.

methods.argstr: c: Card, lv: number, desc: number, ...: number
methods.desc: Adds a Ritual Summoning activation, requring Tributes with any of the card names of code (int ...), and with levels exactly equal to the Ritual Monster's level or if (int lv) is provided, with level equal to that value. (int desc) is the description when activating the Ritual Spell when provided.
A filter used in a Synchro procedure when a material is supposed to be non-Tuner. It also has to satisfy condition of (function f) if provided with (a, b, c) parameters.

A filter used in a Synchro procedure when a material is supposed to be non-Tuner. It also has to satisfy condition of (function f) which has to be Card.IsRace, Card.IsAttribute or Card.IsType, or a function that would use any of these 3. Also, (int val) is a parameter that is used in checking the (function f).

methods.argstr: c: Card, f1: function, min1: number, max1: number, f2: function, min2: number, max2: number, sub1: function, sub2: function, req1: function, reqct1: number, req2: function, reqct2: number, reqm: function
methods.desc: Adds a Synchro Procedure to (Card c) where (function f1) is the required Tuner, with a minimum (int min1) and maximum (int max1). (function f2) is the second material (which usually is a non-Tuner, with a minimum (int min2) and maximum (int max2). (function sub1) is a Tuner substitute (e.g. Nirvana High Paladin) while (function sub2) is a substitute to the second material(s). (function req1) are required Tuners to be used in that Summon, with a fixed number (int reqct1) on how many are needed to be used. (function req2) follows the same pattern but for the secondary material (e.g. Crystal Wing Synchro Dragon (Anime)). (function reqm) is the required material needed to be used in that Summon regardless if it's a Tuner or the second material (e.g. function overwrite by Blackwing - Gofu the Vague Shadow (Anime)).

a number representing how and where the Synchro Materials would be sent. 0 - (default) to grave, 1- to grave, returned from banished, 2 - banished face-up, 3 - banished face-down, 4 - sent to hand, 5, sent to Deck, 6 - destroyed.

methods.argstr: c: Card, f1: function, cbt1: boolean, f2: function, cbt2: boolean, f3: function, cbt3: boolean, ...: function
methods.desc: Adds a Synchro Procedure to (Card c) used by Majestic Star Dragon where (function f1, f2 and f3) are the required material and (bool cbt1, cbt2 and cbt3) are a check if the respective material can be used as the Tuner in the Summon since rulings for Majestic Star/Red Dragon state that either or both Majestic Dragon (f1) and/or Stardust Dragon/Red Dragon Archfiend (f2) can be used as the Tuner, but the non-Tuner, for the case of using Phantom King Hydride (f3) cannot be treated as the Tuner for the Summon. You require a minimum of 1 among these 3 to be the Tuner. (function ...) is the list of required materials during the Summon.

methods.argstr: c: Card, f1: function, f2: function, plv: number, nlv: number, ...: function
methods.desc: Adds a Synchro Procedure to (Card c) used by Dark Synchros where (function f1) is the first material, usually used by the non-Tuner and (function f2) as the Dark Tuner, whose Level to be subtracted from the first material. (int plv) is the target level when both materials are of positive value while (int nlv) is the target value if the first material is affected by Dark Wave. (int plv) defaults to the Synchro monster's level while (int nlv) defaults to the (int plv) if not supplied. (function ...) is the list of required materials during the Summon.

methods.argstr: c: Card, f: function|nil, lv: number|nil, ct: number, alterf: f|nil, desc: number, maxct: number=ct, op: function, mustbemat: boolean, exchk: function
methods.desc: Adds an Xyz Procedure where (function f) is the required Xyz Material, and (int lv) is the required level, but it can also be nil if there is no required Level. (int ct) is the required number of materials. (function alterf) is the alternate material, e.g. Number C39: Utopia Ray. (int desc) is the description shown when attempting to Xyz Summon using (function alterf). (int maxct) is the maximum number of materials, which defaults to (int ct). (function op) is used by some monsters do something else in addition to using an Xyz Material (e.g. Digital Bug Corebage (detach 2 materials) or Number 99: Utopic Dragon (discard 1 "Rank-Up-Magic")). (bool mustbemat) is used if you can only use the listed materials during the Xyz Summon, this disallows Anime effects such as Orichalcum Chain (minus 1 material) or Triangle Evolution (triple material). (function exchk) is an additional check at the end of selecting materials (e.g. Number F0: Utopic Future (checks if the materials have the same Rank)

methods.argstr: c: Card[, reg: boolean=true, desc: number|nil]
methods.desc: Applies all the effects necessary for a Pendulum card to be used as one to (Card c). Setting (bool reg) to false, will not register the activation effect, which is used in cards that cannot be activated since you don't have them in your hand (e.g. Xyz/Pendulums). (int desc) is an optional parameter adding a description to your Pendulum Activation.

methods.argstr: c: Card, f: function|nil, min: number, max: number = c:GetLink(), specialchk: function|nil, desc: number
methods.desc: Adds a Link Procedure where (function f) is the required material with a minimum (int min) and maximum (int max) where (function specialchk) is an additional check after obtaining all materials (e.g. Akashic Magician) and (int desc) is the description to its Link Summoning Procedure,
Sends (any msg) as a script error to the logs

methods.argstr: code: number, owner: number, player: number, location: number, seq: number, pos: number[, proc: boolean=false]
methods.desc: Add a card of (int code), owned by (int owner) and under (int player)'s control, to (int seq) of (int location) in (int pos) position. If (bool proc) is true, it will be treated as properly summoned for the purposes of revive limits.

methods.argstr: playerid: number, lp: number, startcount: number, drawcount: number
methods.desc: Set (int playerid) to have (int lp) LP, start with a (in startct) card hand, and draw (int drawcount) during the Draw Phase.

methods.argstr: c: Card, sum_type: number[, sum_location: number=0]
methods.desc: Treat (Card c) as if it was summoned by (int sum_type), to (int sum_location)
